definition: see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: This is a devastating and, I think, brilliant argument.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲這是壓倒性的，極其精彩的論證。

sentences.english: Their overwhelming numbers could destroy us.
sentences.chinese: 單憑他們那龐大的壓倒性的人數就可以之我們於死地。

sentences.english: The evidence is overwhelming and the only real disagreement is about intensity.
sentences.chinese: 證據也是壓倒性的，只有在強度方面有不同意見。

sentences.english: There is sufficient evidence that the bird is the offspring of maniraptoran dinosaur.
sentences.chinese: 壓倒性的證據顯示鳥類是手盜龍的後代。

sentences.english: He won the election by a large majority, and has become his party's fair-haired boy.
sentences.chinese: 他以壓倒性的多數票當選，已成爲黨內的紅人。

sentences.english: 1：What are the biggest election landslides in modern history?
sentences.chinese: 近代史上，哪幾次大選取得了最大的壓倒性勝利？

sentences.english: Still, Ravitch's compilation of evidence and argument is overwhelming.
sentences.chinese: 無論如何，拉維切彙集的證據和討論是壓倒性的。

sentences.english: Kennett, of course, was the incumbent and overwhelming favourite in that election.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼特當然，是在該選舉現任和壓倒性的最愛。

sentences.english: Mr. Erdogan won last year's general election with a landslide victory.
sentences.chinese: 埃爾多安去年以壓倒性勝利贏得大選。
